Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: SandraMSA
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very cozy and clean. It is close to transportation facilities. Breakfast is good for the type of hotel. Attention to those who arrive after 22:00 must inform the hotel because there is no reception service after this time. The only inconvenience was the fact that we hear some noise of the tram and the internet was not wireless. Hotel to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gm_goa
Reviews.Content: a gem of a hotel, and i did this booking through HRS, I was really impressed with the size of the rooms and the ameneties, and besides being very centrally located, The staff also very helpful and would make it a point to see that we were comfortable, transportation around the hotel is also very good and the main reason to be in Berlin was the ITB and i must say it was no problem to travel. Will surely stay back the next time

Reviews.Title: “Nice for New Years in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Johnathan B
Reviews.Content: The Kastanienhof was recommended to us and we are very happy to be here. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside: wow! The hotel is really in the middle of Prenzlauer Berg, a cool and hip place with tons of clubs, bars, and restaurants. Convient public transportation links the hotel with the rest of the city quickly and convienently. Since the hotel is in an old building, the room we have is a little oddly shaped and proportioned, but elegant, clean, and well proportioned. Breakfsts is a treat and the rich buffett begged us to stay for seconds. The staff even let us take a snack for later. We will definitely stay here again, but think about the sound of the tram ouotside 24/7 and that there is noone in the hotel with any kind of responsibility at night time. Plus, there in no internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Paul7878
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located along a tram line. The stop is nearly right in front of the hotel. I went in the fall so the weather wasn't too warm. I don't know how the building would fare in hot weather given that I didn't see any air conditioning in the rooms. The wi-fi only works in the lobby. Sometimes the signal gets to the upper floors, but otherwise count on it only in lobby. The reception and public areas close at 10:00pm so if you want to use the wi-fi at night, you will have to sit in the stairway. The hotel sells the various transit passes and museum passes so its convenient in that way too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MeinhardG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights so it was a great deal - Euros 100 / night with breakfast and WIFI included. Large rooms, very clean, great front desk with all types of info and they are selling transit cards and also speak fluent English. Very god breakfast (the room may fill up and you have to eat in the small bar area). a tram stop outside the hotel is very convenient and gets you anywhere. Great restaurants around the hotel and no problem walking the area. The front rooms can be noisy - from the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant return at this old-fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: MereteJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kastanienhof for the third time within a period of four years - as expected, I was met by the same friendly staff, calm atmosphere, and a decor reminding me of visiting my grandmother. This hotel is cozy, nice, and slightly at odds with its trendy neighbourhood, as time does not really seem to have passed since the 50s at Kastanienhof. Large, quiet, clean and comfortable room, excellent breakfast buffet, and great central location - only drawback is that the hotel is slightly pricey compared to other hotels of similar standard in Berlin, and there is no wireless internet. (Which, assumably, is due to that most visitors seem to be 50+ and not business travelers.) In short, if you're looking for a friendly retro atmosphere, this is for you - if you're a younger person or in need of business services, you might feel a bit out of place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice of hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eirene_paulidou
Reviews.Content: Good sized room, very clean, convenient location, lively neighbourhood, good access to transport (tram and u-bahn) , good base from which to move around, friendly staff, very good breakfast. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in a great location”
Reviews.Author: abenteuerwelt
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pension Kastanienhof is located in Prenslauer Berg--a fun area with lots of shops and restaurants. The staff is friendly and communicative. I had a single room on the top floor that was very comfortable. The hotel was very clean and the prices were reasonable. The charming old building has an interesting history that is explained in the hotel brochure. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly little hotel in a wonderful part of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Norwagabond
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in this great little hotel in Prenzlauer, a charming, youthful neighborhood with lots of cool cafes and bars. Staff is very helpful and friendly, location is fabulous if this is the neighborhood you're after. Very quiet rooms if you sacrifice the view over Kastanienallee. Bathrooms was better than expected from a three star hotel. The hotel does not have a night receptionist, you get an electronic key that opens the front door. Breakfast is excellent and included in room price. Make sure to get an espresso and the apple tart in the cafe across the street, a real gem. Last tip: Hire a bicycle. This is by far the best way of exploring Berlin, and the hotel has bikes for rent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable accommodation, don't forget to give back your room key!”
Reviews.Author: SiMart71
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor. The location is central, without being in the noisy part of town. The staff are helpful and accommodating to an extent. One mistake we made was to not confirm a non-smoking room prior to arrival, and by the time we checked in, a smoking room was all they had available. Luckily our room smelled ok, and it was not too cold to keep the windows open a crack and allow air flow to flow in at night. But, traveler be warned! We wont make that mistake again. The rooms are spacious, simple and clean, and we even had a table with two chairs in our room. Although the hotel only offers hard wire Internet ( a little archaic to not offer wireless in this day and age?), there is a laptop available for use in the office, for a small fee. Our stay overall was satisfactory, although we were disappointed at the end when as we were bringing down our suitcases to depart, my partner was growled at by the lady at reception that he must not leave without returning our room keys. This, without so much as a greeting of good morning from her, and also when it was quite obvious he was not making an attempt to walk put of the hotel just yet. We're just saying, she could have made the request in a more polite manner.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Racheybabes31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Berlin this weekend for the marathon. The hotel is situated in a lively district with loads of different types of bar and restaurant in walking distance. The U-bahn (underground) is a 5 minute walk away and that gets you to all the main tourist attractions no bother. Our room was bigger than expected with a good bathroom and power shower (heaven after running all that way in the rain!). We asked for a double room but it had twin beds, but still comfortable. We didn't have breakfast there but when we asked if it was possible to have tea and coffee making facilities a kettle and cups were quickly provided! Staff also very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: Flgirl01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and were very comfortable. Out of the city centre a bit, but in a charming neighborhood with lots of dining/shopping options around. Many great restaurants in the area. The hotel staff were more than helpful and friendly, very accommodating. Great breakfast. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in the middle of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Twoexpats
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. The staff are friendly and incredibly helpful--they will assist you with directions to city attractions and help you navigate Berlin's public transportation system. Rooms are clean, spacious and well appointed. Breakfast may or may not be included in the rate--be careful--if you get a special deal on the room you may have to pay extra for breakfast. There is plenty of public transportation as well as a good selection of restaurants around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a busy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: wkuehner
Reviews.Content: The Kastanienhof is on the busiest street of the Prenzlauer Berg neighborhood, so public transport is easily accessible (a tram runs in front) but it's also quite noisy. Our room was on the 4th floor, right under the roof, so we had no windows to the street, only roof windows. The lift only went to the 3rd floor, so we had to walk up a flight. The breakfast was good and abundant. The staff was largely helpful, if a bit brusque.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: tigerb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in fall 2005 as part of a Rick Steves tour. Very nice hotel, immaculate, excellent breakfast. The streetcar right outside is very convenient... but it was a little noisy under our window. Short walk to the U-bahn, too. Great beer garden a couple blocks away. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MozeMoose
Reviews.Content: Loved the breakfast. Double room very spacious. Little dicey finding the place at first. We eventually learned to take the S-Bahn to Hackischer Markt, and then take the street car going north. It drops you right in front of the place, thereby making it a great location at a good price. We will visit the place again if we are in Berlin. Also loved the numerous maps they had as wall decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, homely and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MereteJ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Kastanienhof on three occassions and all three have been very positive experiences. The staff members are all extremely nice and always willing to help - ask for a room facing the street, and you will get a nice view of Kastanienallée without too much noise. The breakfast is excellent. I have been arriving very early on all three visits, and it has been a great pleasure that I could access my room immediately upon my arrival. Only drawbacks are that it's somewhat expensive compared to hotels of similar standards, and the decorating - especially in the lobby - is quite tacky and touristey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel during the first week of July in 2005. The tram stop is right next to the hotel. The breakfast was great. They had a wide spread from cereal to sliced meats and cheeses. I would recommend the hotel if you have a little extra money to spend. The rooms were nice and they are very courtious people working. The bathroom was excellent compaired to the hotel that we stayed in Paris. Berlin is the cleanest city I been in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “"great breakfast" and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nevilledog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2002 so the rate of exchange was much better and the cost for a double room came to about 90.00 USD that would be more now, but the rooms were great and the breakfast was wonderful. Lots of nice fresh rolls, pastries juices cheese etc. Good location a tram stop right in front of hotel and a 3 block walk to get subway. The only drawback was there are no restaurants nearby so you have to plan were you will eat to avoid going back and forth to hotel. We asked for a room facing the back I would think there would be a lot of traffic noise if u were facing the street.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Pension Kastanienhof
HotelInfo.Address: Kastanienallee 65, 10119 Berlin, Germany
